item.title: Maui Pineapple Farm Tour in Haliimaile
item.description: Hawaii has a rich history of pineapple farming and this tour puts it all into perspective. Head to the historic plantation town of Hali'imaile to walk around a working pineapple field. Learn about pineapple growing cycles and cultivation from your guide and sample the fruit at its different stages. Best of all, each guest receives an 'airport-ready,' fresh pineapple at the end of the tour.

image.alt: Maui Pineapple Farm Tour in Haliimaile

item.title: Small-Group Road to Hana Adventure Tour with Pickup B/F & Lunch
item.description: Hit the world-famous road to Hana during the full-day sightseeing tour of this byway’s lush farms, scenic overlooks, and rich Hawaiian history. Try to keep your jaw from dropping as you proceed along this iconic north-Maui route, passing postcard-perfect scenery at Wai'anapanapa State Park, Ho’okipa Beach Park, and Waikani Falls. Continue on to Ke’anae, a historic Hawaiian hamlet known for its fisherman and photo-worthy atmosphere, and see the final resting place of aviator Charles Lindbergh. A guide, round-trip hotel transport, and lunch are all included.

image.alt: Small-Group Road to Hana Adventure Tour with Pickup B/F & Lunch

item.title: Haleakala Sunrise Spectacular: Legendary Views + Local Breakfast
item.description: Experience an incredible daybreak view from the top of Maui’s highest peak during this full-day Mt. Haleakala sunrise tour. Journey with a guide on this massive volcano to witness the orange and red-colored dawn of a new day set amidst the clouds, enjoying the sublime beauty of a sight that once inspired literary great Mark Twain. This Maui sunrise excursion also includes round-trip hotel transportation, breakfast, and entrance fees.

image.alt: Haleakala Sunrise Spectacular: Legendary Views + Local Breakfast

item.title: Molokini Snorkeling Adventure Aboard Calypso From Ma'alaea Harbor
item.description: Over 200 different species of fish inhabit Molokini Crater, and you have the chance to search for them all aboard this Maui snorkeling tour. Inside this ancient volcanic caldera that rises up out of the sea, you might also find manta rays, sea urchins, eels, or even a harmless shark. This tour also stops at a spot called Turtle Town along the Maui coastline, where you have the chance to swim alongside enormous Hawaiian Green sea turtles. Enjoy amenities like a glass-bottom viewing room and snorkeling equipment as well as a buffet lunch on the triple-decker catamaran.

image.alt: Molokini Snorkeling Adventure Aboard Calypso From Ma'alaea Harbor

item.title: 7-Line Maui Zipline on the North Shore
item.description: Zoom above the treetops and enjoy stellar ocean views during this zipline adventure tour at historic World War ll base, "Camp Maui." Fly across several ziplines, cross the high-altitude suspension bridge, and try other obstacle challenges. Enjoy incredible views of Maui’s North Shore and the Pacific Ocean, plus learn plenty of facts about the island’s unique wildlife, culture and history too. Be sure and check out the new museum at Camp Maui dedicated to the men and women who served there.

image.alt: 7-Line Maui Zipline on the North Shore

item.title: Eye-Level Whale Watching Eco-Raft Tour from Lahaina
item.description:
This tour departs from Lahaina, Maui to find the majestic humpback whales that frequent the waters surrounding Maui in the winter months. Traveling in a small raft creates an intimate whale watching experience not found on the larger vessels commonly used on whale watching tours. Plus, the raft travels quickly, letting you spend more time whale watching and less time in transit.
-Enjoy a small group whale watching tour off the coast of Maui. -You can choose from a morning or afternoon tour so it doesn’t interfere with other plans -In the event of cancellation due to weather, you are offered an alternate outing or a full refund -Prepare for the chance to photograph whales in their natural habitat

image.alt: Eye-Level Whale Watching Eco-Raft Tour from Lahaina

item.title: Turtle Town Snorkel with Photo and Video
item.description: If you’re looking to explore the well-known Turtle Town of Maluaka Beach in Maui, but want to do it right, prebook this snorkeling experience. Along with your guide helping to navigate the way to show you the best spots to snorkel in, you’ll also get your equipment provided for you and pictures and video taken so you can remember your trip. Plus, life jackets are also provided for ultimate safety.

image.alt: Turtle Town Snorkel with Photo and Video

item.title: Molokini Crater and South Maui Coast Adventure from Kihei
item.description: Discover the amazing array of marine life that populates Maui’s Molokini Crater during this small-group snorkeling trip. Head by boat to this long-extinct volcanic crater just off Maui, a top-notch snorkeling site where visibility often surpasses 180 feet (55m). Among the many creatures you may spot during your adventure are rays, tropical fish and variety of other wildlife. Finish your trip at ‘Turtle Town,’ another well-known snorkel site where you can glide through the water with Hawaiian Green Sea Turtles. Your snorkel trip also includes, breakfast, lunch, local guide and snorkel equipment.

image.alt: Molokini Crater and South Maui Coast Adventure from Kihei

item.title: Lahaina ATV Adventure, Maui
item.description: Hit the road on an off-road vehicle during this rugged UTV tour of Lahaina. Ideal for families or groups of friends, four-seater vehicles allow you to take the wheel or simply be a passenger. Choose to drive or be a passenger as you explore the West Side Adventure, which includes a ride through Pu'u Kukui Watershed Preserve.

image.alt: Lahaina ATV Adventure, Maui

item.title: Small Group Waterfall and Rainforest Hiking Adventure on Maui
item.description: Experience the lush beauty of East Maui on this guided rainforest hike. Cruise the scenic Hana Highway in complimentary transportation, then embark on your trek with an informative local guide. Learn about the Maui’s ecosystems, marvel at magical waterfalls, climb basalt rock formations, and leap into the freshwater pools below for a refreshing swim. Enjoy a delicious, healthy lunch along the way—it’s included in the tour price.

image.alt: Small Group Waterfall and Rainforest Hiking Adventure on Maui

item.title: Molokini Crater Zodiac Adventure: Snorkel and Turtle Cove Swim
item.description: Go snorkeling in Maui with a half-day excursion to Molokini Crater and Turtle Cove. Climb aboard a boat for a scenic journey to Molokini Crater and then get in the water to snorkel at your leisure. See up to 250 species of reef fish and coral formations during the underwater adventure at this submerged volcanic crater. Continue on to Turtle Cove, a popular place to spot Green Sea Turtles. Lunch, snacks, and non-alcoholic drinks are included.

image.alt: Molokini Crater Zodiac Adventure: Snorkel and Turtle Cove Swim

item.title: Road to Hana Adventure Maui Tour with Lunch
item.description: On this guided, full day tour of Hana, enjoy the diverse and tropical beauty of the famous Road to Hana. Stop for photos at waterfalls and a black sand beach. With an informative guide behind the wheel, this is one of the best ways to visit Hana—especially if you don’t want to drive!

image.alt: Road to Hana Adventure Maui Tour with Lunch

item.title: Original Sunset Cruise with Open Bar from Ka’anapali Beach
item.description: Enjoy a ‘front-row seat’ for Maui’s epic sunset accompanied by cocktails and snacks during this sailing cruise from Ka’anapali Beach. Enjoy views of nearby Lanai, Molokai, and Kahoolawe from your boat, drink and food in hand, as the Hawaiian sky puts on its nightly display. Plus, keep your eyes peeled for local marine life, including whales from mid-December to mid-April. Snacks, unlimited alcoholic drinks, and non-alcoholic beverages are all included.

image.alt: Original Sunset Cruise with Open Bar from Ka’anapali Beach

item.title: Maui Zipline Eco Adventure: 8 Lines through the Jungle
item.description: Fly through the treetops on a zipline course through the jungle environment of Haiku with this thrilling tour. Cross eight ziplines, three tree platforms, two swinging bridges, and a suspension bridge all in a couple of hours. This is a great activity to enjoy if you're taking a day trip on Maui's Hana Highway or visiting area waterfalls.

image.alt: Maui Zipline Eco Adventure: 8 Lines through the Jungle

item.title: Te Au Moana Luau at The Wailea Beach Marriott Resort on Maui, Hawaii
item.description: Participate in a traditional Hawaiian luau during your time in Maui and learn about the Polynesian ancestry of the islands. Watch dancers portray the stories of fishing, gathering, and voyaging in “Te Au Moana: The Ocean Tide” along with pre-show entertainment, a delicious all-you-can-eat buffet, and a fire knife performance.

image.alt: Te Au Moana Luau at The Wailea Beach Marriott Resort on Maui, Hawaii

item.title: From Maalaea Harbor: Whale Watching Tour Aboard the Quicksilver
item.description: Observe humpback whales in their natural habitat during their return migration to Maui’s waters December–April. This whale watching adventure by high-speed catamaran provides a front row seat to fin slaps, flukes, and breaches. Underwater hydrophones help you hear whale songs, while the captain and crew provide the commentary. Juices and sodas are available on board to keep passengers hydrated.

image.alt: From Maalaea Harbor: Whale Watching Tour Aboard the Quicksilver

item.title: West Maui Half Day Snorkel from Ka’anapali Beach
item.description: Dive in to explore West Maui's underwater world during this half-day snorkeling excursion from Ka'anapali Beach. Under the guidance of your experienced captain, travel to some of the island's best snorkel locations to see green sea turtles (honu), schools of colorful tropical fish and maybe spinner dolphins, bottlenose dolphins, or even humpback whales (seasonal). After snorkeling, enjoy a delicious lunch onboard the boat, accompanied by nonalcoholic refreshments and beer and cocktails for purchase. Breakfast, lunch, and use of snorkel equipment are included.

image.alt: West Maui Half Day Snorkel from Ka’anapali Beach

item.title: Haleakala 5 Line Zipline Adventure
item.description: Get your adrenaline pumping on a daring 1.5-hour zip-line adventure through Maui’s tropical forests. Hike along the treetops on a wooden plank bridge, and then glide along five zip-lines that take you past Haleakala volcano, near the entrance to Haleakala National park. Feel the wind rushing past as you take in lush, tropical views, and learn abut Maui’s diverse natural environment from your guide.

image.alt: Haleakala 5 Line Zipline Adventure

item.title: Maui Snorkeling Molokini Crater and Turtle Town
item.description: A trip to Molokini Crater grants visitors the chance to take in scenic ocean views from a catamaran and discover the world below the surface while snorkeling at the underwater lava formations of Turtle Town. The calm water and bountiful marine life make this an ideal snorkeling spot for everyone from first-timers to long-time snorkeling enthusiasts. Plus, a guide provides security and instruction for beginners.

image.alt: Maui Snorkeling Molokini Crater and Turtle Town

item.title: Small Group Road to Hāna Tour 6 to 8 passengers
item.description: Discover one of America's most famous road trips on this small-group adventure from Lahaina. Travel along the Road to Hana, filled with curves and 1-lane bridges, with an experienced driver. Stop at several locations along the way including Ho'okipa Park, Huelo, Hanawi Falls, Hana Bay, Haleakala Volcano, and many more, to see lush landscapes and ocean views.

image.alt: Small Group Road to Hāna Tour 6 to 8 passengers

item.title: Group Surf Lesson: Two Hours of Beginners Instruction in Kihei
item.description: Catch a wave of excitement as you learn to surf during this 2-hour beginner’s, small-group, lesson in Maui. Join no more than 6 other students for an introduction to the fundamentals of surfing, including ocean awareness, water safety, riding skills and proper etiquette. You’re guaranteed to be surfing in one easy lesson, or your next lesson is free! An instructor, surfboard and rash guard are all included.

image.alt: Group Surf Lesson: Two Hours of Beginners Instruction in Kihei

item.title: Molokini and Turtle Arches Snorkeling Trip from Ma'alaea Harbor
item.description: Get off the beaten path to explore the wild side of Molokini on this half-day adventure from Maui. The small, crescent-shaped island of Molokini is an extinct volcanic crater with a thriving coral reef, home to more than 250 species of fish and 38 species of coral. Hop aboard a 54-foot, single-deck catamaran and jump in the water for a snorkel at the Turtle Arches reef. Then, cruise around Molokini's rugged, red rock back wall, home to a variety of seabirds. Snorkeling equipment plus a continental breakfast, buffet lunch, and refreshments are included.

image.alt: Molokini and Turtle Arches Snorkeling Trip from Ma'alaea Harbor

item.title: Small-Group Whale Watching Adventure
item.description: Our small group experience takes place in a big boat atmosphere! A maximum of 20 guests onboard allows our captain and crew the chance to focus on providing each guest with the very best experience. Our boat is really what sets us apart from other companies- we have a fast, fun and extremely comfortable boat where everyone has a cushioned seat, large open platform for viewing the whales and fast, quiet engines to help us maximize our time with the whales during your tour. Knowledgeable captains and crew who have worked among the whales for years will share whale facts and answer your questions. It's a great photo opportunity and most people who do it come back for more!

image.alt: Small-Group Whale Watching Adventure

item.title: Lahaina: Maui Ku'ia Estate Guided Cacao Farm Tour and Tasting
item.description: Learn all the secrets of the chocolate-making process—and go behind the scenes at Hawaii’s largest chocolate factory—on this decadent, small-group tour. Pick from multiple tour times, make your own way to the Ku’ia Estate Chocolate Factory, and then drive with your guide to the nearby estate. See cocoa pods growing and learn about the harvesting process before indulging in a delicious and informative tasting of nine different chocolates.

image.alt: Lahaina: Maui Ku'ia Estate Guided Cacao Farm Tour and Tasting
